info.title: Calls
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: If your team isn't using the HubSpot calling tool to make calls to prospects, you can use the calls API to log call information from another service to your HubSpot account.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the call engagements API to associate calls with your CRM records. You can include key takeaways in the metadata of each call, including the call's outcome, recipient information, and a URL of the recording, if applicable.

post.description: Retrieve a batch of calls by ID.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only calls that have been deleted.

get.description: Retrieve a call by its ID (`callId`) or by a unique property (`idProperty`). You can specify what is returned using the `properties` query parameter.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique for this object

delete.description: Delete a call by ID. A deleted call can be restored within 90 days of being deleted, but the recording will be permanently deleted. Learn more about [restoring activity records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-activity-in-a-record).

patch.description: Update a call by ID. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will result in an error. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: The name of a property whose values are unique.

post.description: Archive a batch of calls by ID. Deleted calls can be restored within 90 days of being deleted, but call recordings recording will be permanently deleted. Learn more about [restoring activity records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-activity-in-a-record).

Create a batch of calls. The `inputs` array can contain a `properties` object to define property values for each record, along with an `associations` array to define [associations](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.
Update a batch of calls by ID.

get.description: Retrieve all calls, using query parameters to specify the information that gets returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A comma separated list of the properties to be returned along with their history of previous values. If any of the specified properties are not present on the requested object(s), they will be ignored. Usage of this parameter will reduce the maximum number of objects that can be read by a single request.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A comma separated list of object types to retrieve associated IDs for. If any of the specified associations do not exist, they will be ignored.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

post.description: Create a single call. Include a `properties` object to define property values for the record, along with an `associations` array to define call associations(https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/associations/associations-v4) with other CRM records.

post.summary: Create or update a batch of calls by unique property
post.description: Create or update a batch of calls by ID (`callId`) or unique property value (`idProperty`).

Search for calls by filtering on properties, searching through associations, and sorting results. Learn more about [CRM search](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search#make-a-search-request).

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

properties.hs_call_body: Decision maker out, will call back tomorrow

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
